com.jmex.physics
Class DynamicPhysicsObject

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.PhysicsObject
      com.jmex.physics.DynamicPhysicsObject

public class DynamicPhysicsObject
extends PhysicsObject

DynamicPhysicsObject is a PhysicsObject with dynamical properties, such as mass, velocity, applied forces etc.

When a dynamic object gets attached to the PhysicsWorld, a PhysicsSynchronizer will be added to it. It makes sure the jME geometry matches the ODE geometrys position and rotation, thus making the simulation come to life.

TODO: Add wrappers for all the relevant remaining functions of Body. E.g. setForce, getForce, addRelForceAtPos etc.

Author:
Ahmed Al-Hindawi, Per Thulin
See Also:
PhysicsWorld, PhysicsObject, StaticPhysicsObject

setGravityMode

public void setGravityMode(int mode)
Change the mode of how gravity affects this geometry. A value of 1 will tell the dynamicEntity to obey the world's local gravity, a value of 0 will ignore it.

Parameters:
mode - A value of 1 for global gravity, 0 for no gravity.

getGravityMode

public int getGravityMode()
Get the current mode describing how global gravity will effect this dynamicEntity. A value of 1 indicates gravity will effect it, a value of zero indicates it will not be effected by gravity.

Returns:
A value of 0 or 1.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
True if this object should interact with other physics objects.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether or not the physics system should affect it.
